bioghist.p: Curtis W. Davis directed culture programs for National Educational Television. He is the author, with Yehudi Menuhin, of The Music of Man, a book of a television series they completed for the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation in 1979. Leopold Stokowski (1882-1977) was the conductor of the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra, the Philadelphia Orchestra, the NBC Symphony Orchestra, Hollywood Bowl Orchestra and the Symphony of the Air. He was the founder of the New York City Symphony and The American Symphony Orchestra.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of research materials on Leopold Stokowski for a planned biography by Curtis Davis. The research was conducted in the 1970s and the early 1980s. Materials include: clippings and copies of articles about Stokowski and other musicians; taped interviews of people who worked with Stokowski; handwritten notes from these interviews; drafts of the biography; genealogical notes; clippings about Stokowski and obituaries; slides and photographs; Curtis's correspondence related to his research; and transcripts of "The Stokowski Story" a series of interviews conducted by Steve Cohen and broadcast on public radio. The collection also includes a small amount of Stokowski's incoming and outgoing correspondence from the late 1960s and early 1970s (originals and photocopies).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
